A legendary masterpiece from an era that's long gone, Half-Life may seem crude with it's visuals and engine designs, but this game is one of the best games ever made for PC. You play as Gordon Freeman, an MIT graduate working at Black Mesa at the wrong time at the right place. After meeting many Barney Calhouns and Dr. Kleiners, you eventually unleash the Resonance Cascade, an event that triggers the start of an alien invasion from the Xen dimension. You'll pick up your trusty crowbar and many dangerous weapons, meet many allies who'll either help shoot off baddies or inject healthy syringes to regain health again, and also come across enemies that'll want to bite your face off or shoot you to pieces. The mysterous G-Man also lingers around once in a while, so you should keep on eye on the guy too while you're at it. Either way, Half-Life is a must-have for your Steam library that you won't regret ever getting.

[h1] ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ - PERFECTION OF λ GENRE [/h1]

The game that transformed the FPS experience forever and raised the standard for quality, once and for all. A one-of-a-kind classic shooter with appealing and varying gameplay, an impressive story that keeps on evolving and intelligent puzzles where realism and sci-fi elements collide, all made with talent and deep passion. Challenge other players in the adrenaline pumping multiplayer, the feature that started the culture of online gaming.

Discover the power of the symbolic crowbar and survive alien creatures from the multiverse and enemy soldiers, in the greatest first-person shooter of all time.

Half-Life is an amazing Sci-Fi first person shooter that was a rather large stepping stone when it came to the video game industry (considering that it might as well be a mod for Quake 2).

Half-Life has a lot of special weapons that will make you love the game.

WOAH WATCH THOSE GIBLETS FLY!

Anywho, I recommend this game if you are a person who loves playing classic video games, I recommend against getting it's insanely shitty Source port (god I remember when I gave Source a good review, I was out of my damn mind).

A masterfully made game in both gameplay and story.  The story is mysterious, but definitely there, and leads you down amazingly designed levels and combat.  The graphics are a bit aged, but it is still clear as to what everything is, and certainly doesn't hurt to look at.

It's a classic fun shooter with a great story.
Pros:
Good gun mechanics 
Good story 
Good graphics, they have aged quite well
Cons:
The game constantly loads which can ruin movement and fluidity of the game.
Can get stuck on certain areas since the game doesn't tell you where to go
Overall its a shooter that's story will intrigue you if you're a fan of Sci-Fi.

Easy to learn, tough to master is the gameplay of Half-Life and its expansions, having much more in common with the cover shooters of today than one would be led to believe by its release date. Along with the official expansions this game has given birth to some of the greatest community created projects. Mods such as They Hunger, BlackOPS, Echoes and many more come to mind as being close to on par with the official releases. Until I run out of mods to play (and the choices are numerous), I will continue to enjoy Half Life for its story-telling and strategic combat.

Half-Life não é um jogo qualquer, sem sombra das dúvidas. Foi um jogo que revolucionou o seu gênero para a época e abriu as portas para milhares de clones. Seu brilho foi com certeza ofuscado pelo tempo pelas diversas inovações de jogos sucessores, mas ainda é um pedaço histórico da indústria dos jogos que ainda deve estar no vocabulário de um jogador. 


Primeiro de tudo, shooters podem ser uma experiência bem cansativa, mais do que outros gêneros. Sim, é divertido acertar um foguete na cara de um demônio de três andares, mas pela vigésima vez você provavelmente deve estar cansado, e sem diversidade você acaba eventualmente desistindo. Half-Life foi um dos primeiros jogos a ensinar que shooters não são sobre atirar, curiosamente, mas sim sobre manter um gameplay fluído. 
O level design é bem misto, mas não que seja mais ou menos, mas num sentido que ou existe capítulos muito bons, ou *muito ruins*. We Got Hostiles, Surface Tension, Blast Pit são exemplos ótimos de capítulos cheios de ação, enquanto Apprehension, Unforeseen Consequences, são capítulos mais tranquilos e focados em outras partes do game, capítulos como Office Complex, Lambda Core e os últimos capítulos são simplesmente exagerados. Felizmente, pelo menos na minha humilde opinião, existem mais capítulos bons do que ruins como mostrei, então sua experiência deve fluir naturalmente.
O arsenal do jogo é no mínimo, interessante. Você tem armas que seriam genéricas e que poderiam vir de qualquer outro jogo da época: Pistola, escopeta, metralhadora, arma de energia, fim. Mas aqui, você tem tiros alternativos, como um lançador de granadas para sua metralhadora, um tiro duplo da sua escopeta (Cujo segundo barril não existe), tiros rápidos da sua pistola em caso de desespero, e por diante. Você também tem as armas menos convencionais, como o revólver que funciona como uma sniper de bolso, uma crossbow que é uma verdadeira sniper, e algumas outras que já são território de spoiler. E mesmo com tantas armas, você nunca sente que alguma arma não é utilizada o suficiente; A pistola é boa para tiros certeiros contra inimigos menores, a metralhadora é boa para distâncias médias, escopeta obviamente contra distâncias menores, e por assim vai. Não é sobre ter armas o suficiente, mas sim armas úteis o suficiente para cada encontro.
E por falar em encontros, não são poucos inimigos que você encontra pelo caminho: Headcrabs, Vortigaunts, zombies, por diante. Esses tipos de inimigos requerem mais concentração para serem derrotados, e fazem melhor para as partes mais tranquilas do jogo. E então, você tem os soldados.
Os soldados são, para falar a verdade, algo que eu não sei o que sentir sobre. Você vê, eles tem uma AI muito avançada, que ainda bate de frente com muitos jogos de hoje em dia, e eles fazem decisões taticamente, como te flanquear, jogar uma granada se você se esconder muito atrás de cobertura, etc. Por outro lado, são um saco de enfrentar pois eles resistem para c*ralho a dano, você tem que literalmente descarregar o tiro duplo da escopeta de perto em um para matar, então o combate é menos realista e mais “pule feito um idiota tentando acertar granadas”.
Uma das características notáveis do jogo é algumas cenas scriptadas. Embora para ser honesto, eu seja bem preconceituoso com a forma que cenas scriptadas são usadas, aqui elas foram usadas bem até; Elas nunca te tiram do controle, e servem mais para dar vida ao mundo ao seu redor, como um Alien Grunt quebrando uma parede na sua frente, ou algum monstro aleatório vindo atrás de você: Momentos como esse te deixam tenso e fazem você querer você pensar além do tempo, e para mim uma pressão sempre é boa.
E por falar em pressão, esse jogo é bem difícil, se não lhe caiu a ficha ainda. A maioria dos tiros [b] vão [/b] pegar em você, dano ambiental é uma coisa (Radioatividade, calor ou frio extremo, etc.) existe também um plataforming que é horrível, então você esteja preparado. Dica, F6 e F7 dão quicksave e quickload, use bem os seus poderes.
 Uma das coisas que passam despercebidas são os pequenos detalhes que o jogo contém, como o fato do sistema de anúncio poder dizer literalmente qualquer coisa, como os soldados tem um sistema de fala que pode ajudar você a previr o que eles farão em seguida, como Bullsquids tem um [/b]senso de cheiro [/b].  Existe uma série no YouTube chamada Half-Life Fact Series que mostra esses e mais detalhes que mostram o amor que a Valve teve por esse jogo.


Se você conseguir passar pelos elementos mais datados, como os gráficos e a dificuldade, Half-Life vai ser uma ótima experiência. Dê uma olhada em alguma gameplay, e esse jogo vai parecer nada especial, mas confie em mim: Você precisa jogar para entender como esse foi um passo revolucionário para o gênero e como o jogo faz para ser uma quasi-experiência engajante e refrescante a cada momento. Realmente, muito melhor do que a soma de suas partes.

Game is half platforming half fps and it doesn't do either very well at all. Audio is absolutely atrocious and has no options to configure it so you can at least hear what NPC's are saying without blowing out your ear drums for any other sound effect. Level design was good but that's about all I can say. Some of the most unsatisfying and crappy gunplay, so many weapons and the ones you're forced to use for 90% of the game are terrible. I don't understand how they could make a game with so much platforming and shooting and then have those mechanics be the weakest and most frustrating. Trying to control the character is a clumsy mess and you may as well be wearing rollerblades with how you slip and slide. Combine that with very finnicky and precise platforming and I can see why volvo decided to just drop developing games and instead fleece nerds out of cash for loot crates and textures. At least they're doing what they're competent at these days.

If you can look past the chunky polygon graphics, the repetitive use of textures, the meh voice acting and the occasionally wonky controls, then this game is one of the best ever made. The combination of a solid combat system (especially for the time), the decently challenging enemy A.I. and the overall passion and personality in the game make for an unforgettable and nostalgic experience that you'll likely find yourself coming back to. My only real problems with the game are that sometimes health stations and ammo pickups are placed too far away from eachother, putting you in difficult situations that will make you want to pull your hair out, and also sometimes the game bugs up and breaks, forcing you to either reload an older save, uninstall and reinstall the game or make a new game. So,,, 

   <  Pros  >
- An overarching sense of nostalgia, even if you just picked up the game
- Great gunplay and combat mechanics for a 20 year old game
- Smooth controls don't take much getting used to, except for rare occasions when they act up
- More of a personal pro but I love the sound effects and design, sound effects become burned into your brain for eternity on account of them being so recognizable, from doors opening to health stations in use, the sounds will stick with you
- Actually challenging gameplay and enemies that will make your life a living hell 
- A game that was clearly made with some love, and isn't a shameless cash grab like most modern AAA titles
   <  Cons  >
- Directions not always clear; easy to get lost despite linear story
- Polygon graphics need adjusting to
- The repeated use of the same textures can become annoying to look at
- Buggy, rare chance of game breaking bugs or softlocks
- Voice acting is minimal and not very engaging

[h1] Half-life [/h1]

[b]Half-life[/b] is the time required for a quantity to reduce to half its initial value. The term is commonly used in nuclear physics to describe how quickly unstable atoms undergo, or how long stable atoms survive, radioactive decay.

It was great.
Just great.

Ah, yes. The one game that started Valve as a whole.

Half-Life has a rather interesting story. You play as a badass scientist named Gordon Freeman who goes on its way to get through the aliens of Xen and apparently the HECU is after you because of the resonance cascade that happened in the beginning of the game.
The gameplay overall is like a stereotypical singleplayer first-person shooter. You go around, killing aliens with your guns, or your crowbar if you're that much of a badass, and the story advances for every path you take. There's some cool weapons as well, like the big-ass laser weapon, and the rocket-powered grenade.

I give this game a 8.4/10 for the storyline. Gameplay however, I think I'd give it a 6.
old game but still is a great game

Bueno que puedo decir de este juego, es un juegazo en toda regla. Empezé a jugar a este juego a la edad de 15 años, en ese primer encuentro con él tuve bastante interés y no me dejó indiferente. La trama era interesante pero por aquel entonces yo no pude jugar el juego completo ya que era una demo, así que ahora que he podido jugarlo, me ha dejado impresionada. La trama especialmente llama la atención porque es bastante enigmático todo y eso hace que te den más ganas de jugarlo. Los personajes no son nada del otro mundo pero son importantes en el desarrollo del juego, los enemigos, el boss final y la dificultad es lo que le da vidilla a este videojuego y están  bastante logrados. La jugabilidad no suele ser gran cosa, es algo tipíco en este tipo de juegos. Los escenarios en los que se desarrolla Half life son lo que más me ha llamado mi atención ya que están realmente bastante logrados y muy pintorescos. En resumen es un juego que hay que jugarlo si o sí porque lo merece por muchas cosas. Lo recomiendo al 100%.

Finally got around to play the original HL1 (previously only played HL: Source). Strangely, despite the hate HLS got for having "too many bugs", HL1 also got some annoying bugs like getting stuck in walls and taking damage when riding elevators. Enemies and the bosses are somehow harder to kill, too. Although I prefer HLS somehow, HL1 is a worthy game to buy, because of the "original" feel and it runs on a different engine.

My first introduction to the Half Life series came from the orange box all the way back in 2007, immediately I was drawn to the vast story of Half life 2 and was enthralled with this labyrinthine experience, entrapped into this wretched cyberpunk dystopian world where anything (from head crabs, combine police soldiers and the occasional ant lion) to everything (exploding barrels, radioactive sewage, and crates of all things! could kill you. Now years later, I am discovering just what a masterpiece the original game is and Im glad contemporary critics are going back and reappraising this game, compared with its amazing sequel. 

The first half life is an atmospheric shooter that tells its narrative through its environment, each encounter feels more random and terrifying then the last. The game excels at not only its platforming and puzzle segments but making the Black Mesa facility a character in its own right. This seedy industrial site feels like it is finally getting its revenge along side the random portal storms inadvertently caused by you. All the while you are being hunted down by seedy government contractors and US wet works assassins. There's this air that you aren't really sure of who this Gordon Freeman really is, a mild manored scientist gifted with incredible tenacity and luck, or something that otherworldly forces and the government has to silence at all costs. Just another great element that fuels this games plot. While the revolutions this game pioneered have changed and evolved to make this game pretty dated, its still, after 20 years, one of the best narrative stories told. I just wish the NPC interactions were a little more nuanced.
